document.discussion_title: Ex-TV show host due back in Louisiana to face rape charges
document.topic_text: May 10, 2016 5:09 PM Ex-TV show host due back in Louisiana to face rape charges The Associated Press Order Reprint of this Story ALEXANDRIA, La. A former children's show host who was arrested in California is heading back to Louisiana to face charges stemming from allegations that he sexually abused children during a camping trip in 1979. Rapides Parish Assistant District Attorney Brian Mosley says sheriff's deputies plan to escort 76-year-old Frank John Selas III on a flight back to Louisiana on Thursday. In San Diego, Selas waived his right to challenge a warrant for his extradition. In the late 1970s, Selas hosted the "Mr. Wonder" show on KNOE-TV in northern Louisiana. He allegedly fled to Brazil in 1979 after parents accused him of abusing their children on a camping trip in central Louisiana. Selas was indicted in February on two counts of aggravated rape and other charges relating to one alleged victim. Related content
